required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized, Prospective Comparison of the Outcome of Toric Implantable Contact Lens (TICL) and Q-LASIK for the Correction of Myopia With Astigmatism
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Prospective Comparison of the Outcome of TICL and Q Value Customized LASIK for the Correction of Myopia With Astigmatism

brief_summary.textblock: The objective is to conduct a contralateral prospective clinical study to compare the safety, efficacy, and quality of vision of the STAAR Surgical Co. Toric Implantable Contact Lens TICL) versus Custom Laser Vision Correction (Q-LASIK) in human eyes for the correction of myopia with astigmatism.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparing the efficacy, predictability, stability and safety of TICL versus Q-LASIK

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparing wavefront aberrometry of TICL vs Q-LASIK Comparing contrast sensitivity of TICL vs Q-LASIK Comparing patient satisfaction of TICL vs Q-LASIK

intervention.intervention_name: the implantation of toric implantable collamer lens
intervention.description: perform the implantation of toric implantable collamer lens for both eyes
perform Q-factor customized laser-assisted in situ keratomileusis for both eyes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age: 21-45 years old
- Documented stable refraction for at least 1 year
- (-3.0 to -8.0D of myopia with -1.0 to -4.0D of astigmatism or SE from -3.5 to -10D
- BSCVA: 20/20 or better
- Pupil diameter: smaller than 7mm under mesopic condition
- Contact lens discontinued 3 weeks and 1 week for hard and soft wearers respectively
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of progressive or acute disease
- Evidence of connective tissue disease or clinically significant atopic disease
- ACD less than 2.8mm from endothelium
- ECC less than 2200 cells/mm2
- Narrow angle of anterior chamber
- Residual stromal thickness less than 280 microns

overall_official.affiliation: Eye hospital of Wenzhou Medical College

facility.name: Eye hospital of Wenzhou Medical College

reference.citation: Sanders DR. Matched population comparison of the Visian Implantable Collamer Lens and standard LASIK for myopia of -3.00 to -7.88 diopters. J Refract Surg. 2007 Jun;23(6):537-53.
Sanders D, Vukich JA. Comparison of implantable collamer lens (ICL) and laser-assisted in situ keratomileusis (LASIK) for low myopia. Cornea. 2006 Dec;25(10):1139-46.
Sanders DR, Vukich JA. Comparison of implantable contact lens and laser assisted in situ keratomileusis for moderate to high myopia. Cornea. 2003 May;22(4):324-31.

responsible_party.organization: Eye hospital of Wenzhou Medical College
